excerpts: Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...
whatever I'm feeling that day.
egg flower soup.author: Kathleen W.
egg flower soup.review:
Simple and sweet food of my people.

As a descendant of a family that owned and ran its own Chinese American restaurant, places like Heung Yuen hold a special place in my heart.  This restaurant has potential with its large tables to accommodate big groups and Chinese families, but every time I go here, the restaurant is below its capacity. The food and decor is simply not trendy enough for the Valencia St crowd and that's okay.  We gotta have some budget food options in this expensive city!

The Korean fried chicken has me coming back here again and again.  Compared to San Tung's wings, these are larger and err more on the sweeter side.  Compared to SO's chicken wings, Heung Yuen's definitely tone down the spice (I prefer the sweet).  

Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...whatever I'm feeling that day.  They are all accompaniments for the main attraction (those wings tho)!! 

Service is speedy.  Menus are tri-lingual (English, Spanish, and Chinese).  And like I said, their prices won't break the bank.

excerpts: Best plates are the Beef Wonton Soup, Chicken Chow Mein, and the Korean Shrimp ...
seriously, I DONT EAT SEAFOOD ...
BUT I LOVE THEIR KOREAN SHRIMP!!!!!
Love this place, im glad that after all these years theyre still in business!
beef wonton soup.author: Jackie R.
beef wonton soup.review: I love this place! Been coming here since I was a baby (im 20 now). Miss Mama tho, wish she was there more often. This place never fails, i dont live in the city anymore but whenever theres a chance, my mom and i come here. Best plates are the Beef Wonton Soup, Chicken Chow Mein, and the Korean Shrimp ...seriously, I DONT EAT SEAFOOD ...BUT I LOVE THEIR KOREAN SHRIMP!!!!! Love this place, im glad that after all these years theyre still in business!

excerpts: Beef wonton soup and mixed meat clay pot were perfect.
Splashed a generous amount of hot sauce on those bad boys, made my day.
Portions are very generous and had me some leftovers for later.
beef wonton soup.author: Hilda Z.
beef wonton soup.review:
Tired of tacos...I asked around the office for lunch ideas. Since I was in the mood for won ton soup, this place was recommended.

It is easy to find on foot. Very basic layout inside. Many tables no frills decoration. Service was quick. Beef wonton soup and mixed meat clay pot were perfect. Splashed a generous amount of hot sauce on those bad boys, made my day. Portions are very generous and had me some leftovers for later.

excerpts: I always got to this place for the Beef Wonton Soup...
I can't get enough.
$5.26 for take out.
When the waiters see me come in with my backpack they always ask me, "Beef Wonton Soup?
LOL
They know me so well.
beef wonton soup.author: Jennifer E.
beef wonton soup.review: I always got to this place for the Beef Wonton Soup...I can't get enough. $5.26 for take out. When the waiters see me come in with my backpack they always ask me, "Beef Wonton Soup?" LOL They know me so well. Besides the soup I also like their Spring Rolls, Korean Shrimp, Pot Stickers, and the Beef and Broccoli. Oh and they're closed Sundays and are Cash only which sucks sometimes.

excerpts: The shrimp wonton soup rules.
shrimp wonton soup.author: Anthony L.
shrimp wonton soup.review: Good Chinese food but the fried rice is not so good. The combo fried rice has no eggs in it and the shrimp are very small. The fried chicken wings in the spicy sauce and the beef and rice noodle dish is good. The shrimp wonton soup rules.

excerpts: I love the shrimp wonton soup, but they use so much msg that I can't eat it.
Otherwise, the flavor is authentic.
If you really want to eat real Chinese, don't order the typical American stuff like kung pao chicken or sweet and sour pork-
that is NOT Chinese food.
Order the steamed fish or vegetable for the day with a simple garlic or oyster sauce.
I wish they had brown rice.
The employees are responsive and very genial.
I come here any day I feel like having a decent meal and to be served.
Just know that you don't have to accept greasy food, you can ask for them to adjust the dish and they will happily oblige.
shrimp wonton soup.author: kim y.
shrimp wonton soup.review: If only people would request that no msg be used in their food, this place would be able to change for the better. I've tried, but my voice is too small. It seems that the rest of the clientele love the msg piled on in buckets. This place is so unpretentious. There is so much potential here. I love the shrimp wonton soup, but they use so much msg that I can't eat it. Otherwise, the flavor is authentic. If you really want to eat real Chinese, don't order the typical American stuff like kung pao chicken or sweet and sour pork- that is NOT Chinese food. Order the steamed fish or vegetable for the day with a simple garlic or oyster sauce. I wish they had brown rice. The employees are responsive and very genial. I come here any day I feel like having a decent meal and to be served. Just know that you don't have to accept greasy food, you can ask for them to adjust the dish and they will happily oblige.

excerpts: Their Korean chicken was a tummyful, so crispy & tasty!!
I asked for hot cautiously, but when I got it, it wasn't too hot.
It was more sweet than hot.
korean chicken.author: Frugal C.
korean chicken.review:
I keep loving going here!!  It's spacious without bumping into other people AND not too many people crowd into here like boogaloo's AND their prices as usual are great for the large plateful of food they give you!!  They have large round tables so it's great for groups and families.  

Again, do NOT come here for gourmet food, the freshest, the bestest, etc.  It's just the usual decently cooked Chinese food, but if you're in the area (because you have to deal with Social Security or go to SF City College's 22nd St branch) and afterwards are hungry for hot prepared food quickly, it's a great choice for the budget conscious and for anyone who doesn't like feeling pressured to eat fast, pay fast, and leave fast for the next crowd to come in which I hate from other places!! Across the street is a parking lot if there's no street parking.  I come in the daytime when the young waitress is there and she's HELPFUL!!  She works way harder than a lot of employees I've seen at many restaurants, even Asian ones.  

The food is as usual LARGE PORTIONS as I enjoyed chomping my way thru my Everest mountain of hot cooked well-flavored BBQ pork rice and I was definitely HUNGRY!!  Their Korean chicken was a tummyful, so crispy & tasty!!  I asked for hot cautiously, but when I got it, it wasn't too hot.  It was more sweet than hot.  The heat was pretty mild.  

Their lunch specials have more rice than actual rice/veggies so if you are NOT especially hungry, go for the discount lunch special.  If you're definitely hungry, go for the separate meals/fried rice/noodles OR try 2 lunch specials.  

For sure, if you have 2 people, if you just order 1 order of fried rice and an entree meal, you can half them for you both and it will be less than $20.  If you're only 1 person ordering them, you'll for sure be taking home a doggie bag of food!!

excerpts: Especially the korean chicken.
korean chicken.author: Gabriel C.
korean chicken.review: I've been going to this place for years. Nice people and good food. Especially the korean chicken.

excerpts: Always Korean chicken, chow mein, fried rice, and friend prawns.
This is the best Chinese food in San Francisco.
korean chicken.author: Miguel P.
korean chicken.review: I've been coming there for decades since I was a kid. My dad would bring this home. Always Korean chicken, chow mein, fried rice, and friend prawns. This is the best Chinese food in San Francisco.

excerpts: KOREAN CHICKEN is better than sex.
Chow fun combination with black bean sauce.
Chow mein pepper beef with black bean sauce.
I bring all my guests here and they leave astonished.
Had friends here from Finland.
France.
And all over the USA.
It os amazing!!!
korean chicken.author: Steven A.
korean chicken.review: OMG. OMG. OMG. THIS IS THE BEST PLACE. We had the pork friend rice. Lemon and orange chicken. KOREAN CHICKEN is better than sex. Chow fun combination with black bean sauce. Chow mein pepper beef with black bean sauce. I bring all my guests here and they leave astonished. Had friends here from Finland. France. And all over the USA. It os amazing!!!

excerpts:
I only order the soup, chow mein, beef in oyster sauce, and Korean chicken wings. 

And the Korean Chicken is pretty bomb.
korean chicken.author: Mitzi G.
korean chicken.review:
I've been coming here since I was a kid and I still love it! I only order the soup, chow mein, beef in oyster sauce, and Korean chicken wings. 

It's my favorite won to soup, outside of Hong Kong. And the Korean Chicken is pretty bomb. 

My Chinese friends like it too! I think that says a lot.

excerpts: I recommend: Korean chicken, pot stickers, BBQ fried Rice's and every time
the Wor Won ton soup, and chicken chow fun...flavor to die for.
korean chicken.author: Sara C.
korean chicken.review:
Been going here for over 30 years, and with 10 minutes to closing time took my phone order and stayed open 15 minutes after closing for me to get there and pick up my order.

I now live in San Jose, and I will drive to SF just to get dinner at Heung Yuen.

I recommend: Korean chicken, pot stickers, BBQ fried Rice's and every time the Wor Won ton soup, and chicken chow fun...flavor to die for. Here I'm just naming a few of the yummy and some of my fav's.

While the Mission District has tons of food options and delicious places.. this one is a must. When looking for a Chinese food run, or soup for feeling sick or hungover.

excerpts: Boneless Korean chicken, house chow mein, shrimp fried rice, honey walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, & wonton soup.
korean chicken.author: Jacqueline R.
korean chicken.review:
My favorite Chinese restaurant in the City. I'm a native of SF's Mission district, where we lived down the street & this was the spot for family celebrations. I remember as a kid, turning the lazy Susan table top as we anxiously waited for our meal. Now as an adult, this is still by far--the go-to for amazing Chino food. 

Personal favs: Boneless Korean chicken, house chow mein, shrimp fried rice, honey walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, & wonton soup. Yummy! 

Great food & the staff are so warm & friendly. Ricky (staff) is the dude! You won't be disappointed. Try it out. :)

excerpts: Best Korean Chicken.
The Fried Fish with Oyster sauce is excellent as well.
korean chicken.author: Jennifer L.
korean chicken.review: I've been going there since I was 6 or 7 years old. Family favorite and now I take my kids there as well. Best Korean Chicken. The Fried Fish with Oyster sauce is excellent as well.

excerpts: Simply the best Korean chicken ever!
Suggesting dishes are pork fried rice, beef chow main and chow fung.
korean chicken.author: Cyndy V.
korean chicken.review: Simply the best Korean chicken ever! Suggesting dishes are pork fried rice, beef chow main and chow fung.

excerpts: I ordered orange chicken over rice, chicken chow mein and the korean chicken wings.
The wings are sooo tasty they are pretty good compared to the other food I ordered.
Like in other reviews mention I agree they are a bit too sweet but still pretty good.
The only thing is that they are really greasy.
The orange chicken over rice I got had a hair in the rice which completly grossed me out
so I ended up throwing that in the trash.
The chicken chow mein has no kind of flavor at all i swear panda express's chow mein is so much better then this one.
The only reason why its getting 2 stars is cause the korean wings are good.
korean chicken.author: Gabriela R.
korean chicken.review:
So  I went to this place because it had 4 stars and the food looked really yummy. I ordered orange chicken over rice, chicken chow mein and the korean chicken wings. 
The wings are sooo tasty they are pretty good compared to the other food I ordered. Like in other reviews mention I agree they are a bit too sweet but still pretty good. The only thing is that they are really greasy. The orange chicken over rice I got had a hair in the rice which completly grossed me out so I ended up throwing that in the trash. The chicken chow mein has no kind of flavor at all i swear panda express's chow mein is so much better then this one. The only reason why its getting 2 stars is cause the korean wings are good.

excerpts: It has not changed at all, and I highly recommend their korean chicken (bone in), with their house fried rice.
That is a meal on its own.
You will not be disappointed.
I come here any chance I get, and every time I have family members that come in from out of town, this is the 1st place they want to stop and eat at.
korean chicken.author: Tasi A.
korean chicken.review: I've been coming here since I was in middle school. It has not changed at all, and I highly recommend their korean chicken (bone in), with their house fried rice. That is a meal on its own. You will not be disappointed. I come here any chance I get, and every time I have family members that come in from out of town, this is the 1st place they want to stop and eat at.

excerpts: Ordered my same thing:  the Korean Chicken & a Steamed Rice to go.
My order this past week was better suited for the Recology Green Compost Bin.
Korean Wings looked great, but every single wing was broken.
Only 1 piece was an unbroken drum-stickette.
These broken wings should of gone into making chicken stock.
Oh never mind.
Previous reviews mention the lack of flavour in their soups.
A food establishment that values their patrons would not serve this rubbish.
Secondly,  my order of steam rice appeared normal.
Maybe the upper portion was fresh?
IDK.
About 1/2 way down the container, I served myself steamed rice with a cauliflower floret.
Where did the cauliflower come from?
I've been eating steamed rice forever.
I know the cauliflower would not survive the steam rice cooking cycle.
Beware of getting used/recycled steamed rice from bussed tables.
Damn gross.
No worries.
korean chicken.author: Helen D.
korean chicken.review:
Really disgusted & disappointed. 
I was an occasional takeout customer for 20+ years. 
Ordered my same thing:  the Korean Chicken & a Steamed Rice to go. 
My order this past week was better suited for the Recology Green Compost Bin.
Korean Wings looked great, but every single wing was broken.   Only 1 piece was an unbroken drum-stickette.
These broken wings should of gone into making chicken stock.  Oh never mind.  Previous reviews mention the lack of flavour in their soups. 
A food establishment that values their patrons would not serve this rubbish.  
Secondly,  my order of steam rice appeared normal.   Maybe the upper portion was fresh?  IDK.   About 1/2 way down the container, I served myself steamed rice with a cauliflower floret.  
Where did the cauliflower come from?   I've been eating steamed rice forever.  I know the cauliflower would not survive the steam rice cooking cycle. 
Beware of getting used/recycled steamed rice from bussed tables.   Damn gross.   No worries.  They will not see me ever again.  

**This review has me giving them 5 negative stars.**

excerpts: Korean chicken is a popular item which my friends always get.
Hot and sour soup is more tart than spicy but not bad.
Fried rice can be bland but just add soy sauce.
korean chicken.author: Julie L.
korean chicken.review: I've always loved this place and always visit when I'm in the area. The chicken mushroom (I add broccoli and go heavy on the sauce) is my fave. There's brown rice options available. Pot stickers aren't crispy but it tastes good w/ the vinegar and hot sauce. Korean chicken is a popular item which my friends always get. Hot and sour soup is more tart than spicy but not bad. Fried rice can be bland but just add soy sauce.

excerpts:
I cane here for the Korean Chicken Wings though.

a soup, fried rice, korean chicken wings, & the potstickers.
korean chicken.author: Ralph N.
korean chicken.review:
It's generally a typical Chinese restaurant. They serve the usual chow mein, fried rice, dinner specials for groups, etc. I cane here for the Korean Chicken Wings though.

I got the combination rice plate w/ a soup, fried rice, korean chicken wings, & the potstickers.

Verdict:

- Fried Rice: Ok. I was hungry so I devoured it. Nothing special.

- Potstickers: Not the best I've had. 

- Korean Wings: Crispy but sauce was a little too sweet and had a tartness in the background. I still like San Tung's version. 

-------------------------------------------------

Overall my experience wasn't worth raving about. Glad I tried it but I would rather go to San Tung for my chicken needs. But if I was in the area...I'd try the other stuff like chow mein & walnut prawns. Prices are relatively low so that's a plus at least.

excerpts: Order the korean chicken wings and the fried rice
you won't regret it.
I'm salivating just thinking about it.
korean chicken.author: Helen Y.
korean chicken.review: The food here is legit!  Hole in the wall in an area that is getting gentrified quickly.  Not sure how much longer this place will be around but I am going to keep going while it is.  Order the korean chicken wings and the fried rice you won't regret it.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.

excerpts: Korean chicken - thought it would be grilled.
Asked for it spicy.
It was basically a deep friend wings in a very sweet sauce.
Their fried rice was bland.
It wasn't just okay
- it was straight up bad.
korean chicken.author: Madhuri K.
korean chicken.review: I have no idea what those other yelpers are talking about.  They have never steered me so wrong.  Sweet and sour chicken- gross.  Korean chicken - thought it would be grilled.  Asked for it spicy.  It was basically a deep friend wings in a very sweet sauce.  Their fried rice was bland.  It wasn't just okay - it was straight up bad.

excerpts: Best Korean chicken
I've ever tasted.

I waited for an hour & 30 
minutes because they close from 3:00-4:00 pm monday thru thursday.
It would of been nice if they would say that on their web page & yelp.
korean chicken.author: Nancy R.
korean chicken.review:
Best Korean chicken I've ever tasted. I waited for an hour & 30 
minutes because they close from 3:00-4:00 pm monday thru thursday. It would of been nice if they would say that on their web page & yelp.

excerpts: the Korean chicken is also superb, you can get boneless or bone in, they have different flavors but both are really good.
the portions are generous and the quality is good.
If your a fan of the korean chicken, and can afford it, they also have korean shrimp.
korean chicken.author: Alex R.
korean chicken.review: Been going to this Chinese spot in the mission since i can remember with my grandma. It seems kind of unusual to have been here for so long given the area. Im glad they are still operational because its one of the better Chinese spots in san fran. always order the soup when dining in, i prefer beef won ton soup. the Korean chicken is also superb, you can get boneless or bone in, they have different flavors but both are really good. the portions are generous and the quality is good. If your a fan of the korean chicken, and can afford it, they also have korean shrimp.

excerpts: GET THE KOREAN CHICKEN.
it's bomb.
other stuff i've ordered here wasn't the best
and i could probably do without.
however, the food is really cheap and again, the korean chicken is SO GOOD (but will definitely give you a food coma afterwards)
korean chicken.author: Amanda L.
korean chicken.review:
GET THE KOREAN CHICKEN. it's bomb. other stuff i've ordered here wasn't the best and i could probably do without. sweet and sour soup is just okay, the dumplings aren't good, and the chow mein isn't great either. 

however, the food is really cheap and again, the korean chicken is SO GOOD (but will definitely give you a food coma afterwards)

excerpts: Went with the Korean chicken chefs special beef chowmein and fried rice, the food was Sub par!
I don't understand what all these great reviews were coming from?
Expected a lot better after reading all the reviews!!
korean chicken.author: David G.
korean chicken.review: After reading all the reviews yesterday me and the family were expecting really good food? Went with the Korean chicken chefs special beef chowmein and fried rice, the food was Sub par! I don't understand what all these great reviews were coming from? Expected a lot better after reading all the reviews!!

excerpts: this place is an old time favorite love being here don't be turned away by the decor that's a distraction come in  and enjoy well made food for reasonable prices and please don't forget the Korean chicken because this resturant makes it the best ........... happy dinning

excerpts: My fav dish: Korean chicken (Obviously), and Chow Mein !!
Korean Chicken is MUST !
+ They recently added new spicy chicken on their menu.
I haven't had time to try it, but I assume it is going to be awsome !
korean chicken.author: Yumi K.
korean chicken.review:
THE BEST OF THE BEST 
I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee this place :)
My fav dish: Korean chicken (Obviously), and Chow Mein !!
Korean Chicken is MUST !

excerpts: I really like the Korean chicken with fried rice.
Eaten here three times and haven't ordered a thing I didn't enjoy.
It's a bit of a dive and you're not paying for ambience, but they do accept credit cards (a rare thing in the mission).
Certainly a great place to order take out to hit the spot when you're craving fast Chinese food.
I recommend and would eat here again.
korean chicken.author: Tony B.
korean chicken.review: Solid Chinese food with dinner combos for under $9. I really like the Korean chicken with fried rice. Eaten here three times and haven't ordered a thing I didn't enjoy. It's a bit of a dive and you're not paying for ambience, but they do accept credit cards (a rare thing in the mission).  Certainly a great place to order take out to hit the spot when you're craving fast Chinese food. I recommend and would eat here again.

excerpts: We ordered hot and sour soup (I didn't realize there would be enough for four or more), dumplings, Korean chicken (amazing chicken wings), Mongolian beef, and beef pan fried noodles.
All of it was amazing and came in huge servings!

And super cheap for the amount of food
Service was sub-par.
korean chicken.author: Carrie N.
korean chicken.review:
Very good food. We ordered hot and sour soup (I didn't realize there would be enough for four or more), dumplings, Korean chicken (amazing chicken wings), Mongolian beef, and beef pan fried noodles. 
All of it was amazing and came in huge servings! And super cheap for the amount of food
Service was sub-par.

excerpts: the korean chicken is soo good!!!
why go all the way to san tung when this is in the mission?!
plus, the chicken wings here are way bigger than san tung.
we always order take
korean chicken.author: Sarina A.
korean chicken.review: the korean chicken is soo good!!! why go all the way to san tung when this is in the mission?! plus, the chicken wings here are way bigger than san tung. we always order take out- korean fried chicken and the special fried rice. portion size is great.

excerpts: The Korean chicken is the best and they have amazing sizzling rice soup, fried rice, and chow mein!
They're extremely inexpensive but delicious food.
I go here so often that they remember my usual!
I love love love it here
that I always have to bring visitors here
and anyone that loves amazing Chinese food
korean chicken.author: Heather S.
korean chicken.review: Best hole in the wall Chinese restaurant in all of SF in my opinion. My parents have been going here way before they were even married and they've been married for 27 going on 28 years. So needless to say I've been going here since I can remember and I'm 26 going on 27. The Korean chicken is the best and they have amazing sizzling rice soup, fried rice, and chow mein! They're extremely inexpensive but delicious food. I go here so often that they remember my usual! I love love love it here that I always have to bring visitors here and anyone that loves amazing Chinese food

excerpts: although after reading other reviews I guess I have been missing out on the Korean Chicken!
korean chicken.author: Margo S.
korean chicken.review:
Took me a couple months of walking by to enter, but once I did, it was love at first bite. 

The wonton soup in incredible. I don't have a go to dish. The menu is huge. Everything I have tried has been delicious... although after reading other reviews I guess I have been missing out on the Korean Chicken!

Great value, friendly service, five stars. I'll be back - often.

excerpts: The Korean chicken is to die for.
It's in the heart of the Mission same recipe as they did in the 80s.
korean chicken.author: Eddy J.
korean chicken.review: Absolutely greatest Korean Chinese food in the Bay Area. The Korean chicken is to die for. It's in the heart of the Mission same recipe as they did in the 80s.

excerpts: I've been eating the Korean chicken from here ever since I've been old enough to eat.
Haha.
My dad used to come pick it up after school for us way back in the day when it was $5 flat for the same size order.
Not only does the food hold many memories for me
but it's just sooo good.
I have yet to find another place that serves Korean chicken like they do.
They're fried rice is great to.
So what it looks like the kinda place that's been around 25+ years.
With all the gentrification going on in that area and the places on Valencia st-it's nice having this spot as an anchor.
The good ole feeling of "some things will never change" (including the f
** you service that comes along with going anywhere with my pops lol)
korean chicken.author: Jessica L.
korean chicken.review: Hits the spot every time. I've been eating the Korean chicken from here ever since I've been old enough to eat. Haha. My dad used to come pick it up after school for us way back in the day when it was $5 flat for the same size order. Not only does the food hold many memories for me but it's just sooo good. I have yet to find another place that serves Korean chicken like they do. They're fried rice is great to. So what it looks like the kinda place that's been around 25+ years. With all the gentrification going on in that area and the places on Valencia st-it's nice having this spot as an anchor. The good ole feeling of "some things will never change" (including the f*** you service that comes along with going anywhere with my pops lol)

excerpts: KOREAN CHICKEN WINGS FTW (if you are sick of Mission Chinese or don't want to wait in the long ass lines of San Tung)
korean chicken.author: Shirley L.
korean chicken.review:
KOREAN CHICKEN WINGS FTW (if you are sick of Mission Chinese or don't want to wait in the long ass lines of San Tung) I recommend their sweet finger licking good chicken wings.

Also their combo wonton soup is cheap, tasty, and great for the winter time (helped me with my cold)

excerpts: There are so many things not to recommend this restaurant--they occasionally mess up phone orders, the atmosphere is entirely lacking, the non-Korean Chicken items I've ordered have been unimpressive, and they don't even have takeout menus.
But in spite of all those things, the Korean Chicken totally and thoroughly carries the day.
Ask for it extra spicy (which still isn't that spicy).
It's one of the best dishes you can get in the Mission, and I say that thoroughly respecting the heavy competition that's around.
korean chicken.author: Victoria P.
korean chicken.review: There are so many things not to recommend this restaurant--they occasionally mess up phone orders, the atmosphere is entirely lacking, the non-Korean Chicken items I've ordered have been unimpressive, and they don't even have takeout menus.  But in spite of all those things, the Korean Chicken totally and thoroughly carries the day.  Ask for it extra spicy (which still isn't that spicy).  It's one of the best dishes you can get in the Mission, and I say that thoroughly respecting the heavy competition that's around.

excerpts: A Cantonese cooks mistaken impression of what Korean chicken "must be like.
So seriously my hipster settler heroes.

Since you put so much money and effort into driving my Latino homiez and their families out of their Mission District homes, and changed its character with your google salaries, then maybe you should start saving some artery space from now on so you can enjoy it, by avoiding this place.
So I'm not gonna run with the pack on this one.
Two stars max for cheap prices.
POSTSCRIPT:
After lunch there, I sat on "the throne" all afternoon and into the evening and night, and no
I ain't the dang Last Emperor.
Haha, very funny.
korean chicken.author: George F.
korean chicken.review: Even though I spent some of my best childhood years growing up in the "Mission District" (us prehistoric originals never call it in Google hipsterese "I'm so cool I live in "The Mission,") I usually avoid eating in the neighborhood I grew up in, thinking of it as kind of the SF version of "The Occupied West Bank" and my original Latino Homiez and their families as the Frisco version of The Palestinians, driven out of their homes by new settlers who claim that the new Google gods gave them the right. But I was invited to have lunch there by an old neighborhood friend who said that he has been eating here at Heung Yuen for 30 years, since he was 2. I should have known better, especially since he's 32 and can hardly walk already, and his right leg is permanently asleep due to poor circulation. But I wanted to see him, so here I was, feeling like I was walking through "occupied Hebron" in "hipster territory" heehee, amid the new "invisible checkpoints," the $100 bistro tabs, designed to keep the original locals out, and among all the $20 coffee "boutiques" and Birkenstock wearing "loungers," acting like they owned these streets, the hallowed grounds where "Los Siete De La Raza roamed" (Google it for more info haha, Google again, such irony,) and the 24th St Boyz held sway, finding my way to Heung Yuen. I sighed when I saw that this place truly hasn't changed from the outside, (and inside) since my childhood, but now, oddly out of place amid the slick themed bistros and bars around it. So anyway, I seldom talk about "health" in these reviews because the assumption is that if my butt is in that chair, it ain't gonna kill me (or you.) But this time I have to  seriously consider my own (and your) mortality when I talk about Heung Yuen, and especially that often reviewed  "sent from heaven" conqueror of the yelp universe, superhero "Korean" chicken. Which btw, truthfully is not really "Korean" or associated with real "Korean chicken"'in any way shape or form. Those of you that are Korean (from The Big K,) or second generation, and know about this, or If you're under 30 and don't know, ask your parents about "Pelicana Chicken," in Korea, the original, who pioneered and commercialized this type, (deep fried glazed,) the template, the "real" no lie, and always the best, and you will know that Heung Yuen's (although yes, crunchy on the outside and yes tender inside,) version's flavors are off, no balance between hot and spicy. An amateur overly sweet snd gratuitously unhealthy, wanna be knock off. A Cantonese cooks mistaken impression of what Korean chicken "must be like." So seriously my hipster settler heroes. Since you put so much money and effort into driving my Latino homiez and their families out of their Mission District homes, and changed its character with your google salaries, then maybe you should start saving some artery space from now on so you can enjoy it, by avoiding this place. So I'm not gonna run with the pack on this one. Two stars max for cheap prices. POSTSCRIPT: After lunch there, I sat on "the throne" all afternoon and into the evening and night, and no I ain't the dang Last Emperor. Haha, very funny.  I swear I can tell the noodles in our bland, greasy tomato beef chow mein, were fried in lard. Yes, I can tell the diff. Cuz I'm the noodle (and sushi) king, no lie. "Noodle G"?" Nah that sounds kinda stupid. Anyway, truthfully, after eating here, my toes and fingers were numb (bad circulation) till the next day. So, if you're a twenty something, you ain't gonna be listenin to me about what you put in your body past your tastebuds anyway. But if you're around 40, then you'll know after the first few bites, that you ain't got no biz eatin this stuff, and putting your body through this, unless your BFF works in the ER and your second BFF is a paramedic to get you there. (Just think of your spouse and kids, and you'll be outta here and on the 48 back to The Sunset in a minute.)

excerpts: Ordered: Korean chicken (boneless), string beans with beef, salt & pepper pork chop, mango shrimp, and seafood pan fried noodle.
The food was eh.... definitely had better.
korean chicken.author: Stephen Y.
korean chicken.review:
This rarely happens but Yelp you failed me last night. Wanted to venture out of my comfort zone (aka The Sunset) and try something in the Mission. The staggering drunk guy outside Heung Yuen should have been the tell-tale sign to turn around and leave. But despite my first ominous sign, we continued. We were seated next to a table of young foul mouth teens (yes, I've turned into a grumpy old man) and this one girl would not stop swearing... every other word was something harsh and terrible - f-bombs, N-bombs, etc. So that's strike two, if you're keeping count. 

Onto the food. Ordered: Korean chicken (boneless), string beans with beef, salt & pepper pork chop, mango shrimp, and seafood pan fried noodle. The food was eh.... definitely had better. Portions were good and the prices were definitely wallet-friendly. 

Their service had mixed reactions. Overall great but at the end of the meal one of the servers started clearing people's plates even though some of us were clearly still eating. I was getting livid but held my tongue cuz I know once I go off, I go off! Granted I think he was clearing the table so that we can cut the birthday cake we'd brought. But by that time we were just ready to leave this place behind us. 

I can see the appeal to this divey Chinese restaurant. It's low-down-dirty-Tuesday-night-I-don't-feel-like-cooking-I'm-ordering-Chinese-take-out kinda place. It's really a quick stop for the locals. And that's where I'm leaving it at... for the locals!

excerpts: Everything on the menu is great but by far the Korean Chicken is my favorite!!
Nice and crispy with just the right amount of spice; eat them while hot!
If you're looking for flashy ambiance this is not the spot for you
but if you like good authentic Chinese food this place comes highly recommended.
Enjoy!
korean chicken.author: M. Naima W.
korean chicken.review: I've been coming here since I was a child when my grandfather owned a dry cleaners up the street. The food has been consistently good and the service is very friendly. I no longer live on San Francisco but whenever I'm in the area I stop in for great Chinese food. Everything on the menu is great but by far the Korean Chicken is my favorite!! Nice and crispy with just the right amount of spice; eat them while hot! If you're looking for flashy ambiance this is not the spot for you but if you like good authentic Chinese food this place comes highly recommended. Enjoy!

excerpts:
What you must try:
Korean chicken - AMAZING.
Crispy, honey crust on the outside, tender juicy meat inside.
korean chicken.author: Mariela D.
korean chicken.review:
My husband and I have been coming here since we were pre-school aged - that's insane, right?! And the same litte old lady works there - and she hasn't aged a bit! With every visit, she greets us...

"Hi how you? Where you mom? They got lotta kids!" She's hilarious. I love her.

So about the food...sigh. After my hundreds upon hundreds of visits, I can admit that their food is hit-or-miss. Some dishes are fantastic and others are a flop. But I eat there partially because I feel an alliance to the old lady, and partially because my husband refuses to eat Chinese food anywhere else.

What you must try:
Korean chicken - AMAZING. Crispy, honey crust on the outside, tender juicy meat inside.
Potstickers - they are still my favorites after all these years
Wor won ton

Skip:
Rice or chow mein - it's overfried and lacking in flavor. What a huge disappointment.

The food arrives suspiciously fast after you order, and the bill for two is generally under $30, and we have plenty of leftovers. If you order right, this place can be a true gem.

excerpts: Korean Chicken !

korean chicken.review: After reading the reviews, I had great expectations for this place. The food was good, but not like anything I've read here. I got the Korean chicken special with the wonton soup, chow mein, and pot stickers. Everything was average and nothing really stood out to me as amazing. Price was the best part of this restaurant, but the food is nothing to write home about, and I wouldn't actively seek to return.

excerpts: The Korean chicken wings are the only reason I come here.
And I get them to go, where I munch on them with some rice and some steamed veggies.
The wings are deep fried and very crispy, then tossed in a sweet, salty, spicy, sticky goo.
korean chicken.author: J K.
korean chicken.review:
This is an old-school Cantonese dive. I've never seen it more than half full in here, but they always seem to be heavy on the staff. Looking in the open kitchen, there are always at least 5 to 6 people prepping or cooking. I think they get a lot of take out orders.

The Korean chicken wings are the only reason I come here. And I get them to go, where I munch on them with some rice and some steamed veggies. The wings are deep fried and very crispy, then tossed in a sweet, salty, spicy, sticky goo. The sauce could be a bit spicier, but since a healthy order of ~8 to 10 wing joints costs under $8, I can't complain.

They also have clay pot dishes, which I one day hope to try.

excerpts: Hands down one of the best Chinese places ever their Korean chicken and potstickers are smacking
and I love their oyster sauce chicken or beef their wor won ton soup is also on point been going here since I was born and my parents came here
way before they even met
I'm 29
so that's a very long time def recommend this spot.

excerpts: I prefer the BONELESS Korean chicken - white meat nuggets breaded and glazed.
The chowmein is fresh - no noodles stuck together or stale texture and  the staff is always friendly.
Ricky ( the smartass waiter sometimes with the pompadour) is especially friendly as had a great sense of humor.
Since we always order the same stuff he just asks if we're gonna have the same today.
lol

The potstickers are good - I really don't eat them from anywhere else (I'm an egg roll guy) but with the vinegar and oil chili mixture which Ricky usually mixes at the table for us makes them very tasty.
I'm glad the hipsters go everywhere else because I like this place despite the area

Ricky ( the smartass waiter sometimes with the pompadour) is especially friendly as had a great sense of humor. Since we always order the same stuff he just asks if we're gonna have the same today. lol The potstickers are good - I really don't eat them from anywhere else (I'm an egg roll guy) but with the vinegar and oil chili mixture which Ricky usually mixes at the table for us makes them very tasty. I'm glad the hipsters go everywhere else because I like this place despite the area

excerpts: After reading so many glittering reviews of the Korean chicken wings, I decided to give them a go - they were ok at best.
They had only the slightest remittance of heat and the flavor was nothing really special.
I also had some chicken chow mien, which was basically  just a few pieces of chicken, two rather large chunks of celery and noodles covered in a sauce I can't really identify.
Having lived a large chunk of my life in China and elsewhere in Asia, I admittedly have very high standards for Chinese food that this place just didn't quite meet.
The staff, however, was very pleasant and filled my order very quickly.
I'm fully open to the possibility that I just visited on an off night, so I may give them another go.
korean chicken.author: Ben N.
korean chicken.review: I tried a few dishes and was underwhelmed with what I had.  After reading so many glittering reviews of the Korean chicken wings, I decided to give them a go - they were ok at best.  They had only the slightest remittance of heat and the flavor was nothing really special.  I also had some chicken chow mien, which was basically  just a few pieces of chicken, two rather large chunks of celery and noodles covered in a sauce I can't really identify.  Having lived a large chunk of my life in China and elsewhere in Asia, I admittedly have very high standards for Chinese food that this place just didn't quite meet.  The staff, however, was very pleasant and filled my order very quickly.  I'm fully open to the possibility that I just visited on an off night, so I may give them another go.

excerpts: no bean sprouts and Korean Chicken extra sauce- a must.

Please support this restaurant.
The food is excellent and quickly prepared, the staff is friendly and I have never been disappointed here.
Everything on the menu is good.
I hope they stay in business forever as now they're my kids favorite Chinese restaurant as well.
korean chicken.author: Lloyd A.
korean chicken.review: This place is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the City!  They have been feeding my family for 3 generations.  The staff is very warm and friendly.  As soon as I walk in the door they already know what I'm gonna order: Shrimp Chow Mein no bean sprouts and Korean Chicken extra sauce- a must.  If you say your from San Francisco and especially if you claim the Mission District then you already know what I'm talkin about.  Please support this restaurant.  The food is excellent and quickly prepared, the staff is friendly and I have never been disappointed here.  Everything on the menu is good.  I hope they stay in business forever as now they're my kids favorite Chinese restaurant as well.

It's sweet, spicy, sticky, deliciousness!

excerpts: Korean chicken wings for the win!
You have to try it.
