korean chicken.author: Alfonso A.
korean chicken.review: I go here all the time. Korean chicken wings for the win! You have to try it. Service is excellent!

excerpts: Order the chow mein an Korean Chicken.
You will not be disappointed.
A family go to spot for 30 years!
korean chicken.author: Kat J.
korean chicken.review: Order the chow mein an Korean Chicken. You will not be disappointed. A family go to spot for 30 years!

excerpts: Korean chicken..beef...fish?
Damn you Heung Yuen, why must you make me choose?
I'd order them all if I could.
Actually, I'll admit it, I have ordered them all in one sitting and nope, I don't regret it.
Why?
Because this place has hands down the best deep-fried dishes (called "Korean chicken/beef/fish").
You can't ever lose with these hot-spicy-sweet-sour-saucy-crispy pieces of deliciousness.
korean chicken.author: Alexander C.
korean chicken.review:
I hate being indecisive, but its damn near inevitable here. Korean chicken..beef...fish? Damn you Heung Yuen, why must you make me choose? I'd order them all if I could. Actually, I'll admit it, I have ordered them all in one sitting and nope, I don't regret it. Why? Because this place has hands down the best deep-fried dishes (called "Korean chicken/beef/fish"). You can't ever lose with these hot-spicy-sweet-sour-saucy-crispy pieces of deliciousness. I'd bet money on it. 

All the other food is equally amazing, and the service makes everything even better. Its hard to find a place with employees who genuinely care about making customers happy, but Heung Yuen is certainly one of them.

excerpts: The Korean chicken wings are good, but no San Tung.
korean chicken.author: Soysizzle t.
korean chicken.review: Not traditional Chinese food, but pretty damn good and cheap for what it is -- AMC (American Chinese Food). I usually get the combination, which gives you soup of the day (either corn or egg white), fried spring rolls or gyoza, chewy fried rice (that is a good thing!), and a choice of main dish for $10. Everything fried comes out piping hot. The Korean chicken wings are good, but no San Tung.

excerpts: Korean chicken, the Won Ton Soup, Fried Rice, and pot stickers.
Just talking about this place makes me want to order some Chinese food...
It'll be on my to-do list for today!
Too bad they don't deliver lol
korean chicken.author: Deeana ..
korean chicken.review: MY FAVORITE SPOT!!!! I love the food here. I love the boneless Korean chicken, the Won Ton Soup, Fried Rice, and pot stickers. Just talking about this place makes me want to order some Chinese food... It'll be on my to-do list for today! Too bad they don't deliver lol

excerpts: Bf and I ordered the korean chicken, eggplant with garlic sauce, and the salty fish fried rice.
TONS of food - huge portions, cheap prices.
The chicken was good, a bit on the sweet side, but large succulent pieces of juicy chicken.
Eggplant with garlic sauce was good too, and the salty fish fried rice came heaping full on a plate with pungent fish.
korean chicken.author: Carol L.
korean chicken.review:
Yum! Hole in the wall restaurant in the Mission owned by what seems like a Chinese family. I think the whole family works there - old little grandma works there too. Cute! Looks like a lot of neighborhood regulars frequent this restaurant.

Bf and I ordered the korean chicken, eggplant with garlic sauce, and the salty fish fried rice. TONS of food - huge portions, cheap prices. The chicken was good, a bit on the sweet side, but large succulent pieces of juicy chicken. Eggplant with garlic sauce was good too, and the salty fish fried rice came heaping full on a plate with pungent fish. As it should be!

Great neighborhood place, wish I lived closer!

excerpts: as has probably been mentioned many times before, the order of korean chicken is absolutely delicious and worth trying here.
they also have the salted & baked prawns which i eat whole-shell and everything
and they are also delicious.
korean chicken.author: Edwin C.
korean chicken.review:
as has probably been mentioned many times before, the order of korean chicken is absolutely delicious and worth trying here. they also have the salted & baked prawns which i eat whole-shell and everything and they are also delicious. you cant go wrong with lunch orders, either, and they're conveniently priced.

edwin the penguin

excerpts: Here AGAIN having my usual - boneless Korean chicken, shrimp chow fun, steamed rice.
The service is ALWAYS FAST & FRIENDLY!
korean chicken.author: Shana F.
korean chicken.review: Here AGAIN having my usual - boneless Korean chicken, shrimp chow fun, steamed rice. The service is ALWAYS FAST & FRIENDLY!

excerpts: Yelp reviews were raving so much about the Korean chicken I had to try it.
Only ordered the Korean chicken & pot stickers (since everyone seemed to rave about that too).

Since the korean chicken is fried & doused w/ all that spicy/sweet sauce, it really needs to be eaten right away (I did take out & was 15 mins away from home) by the time I got home the chicken on the bottom was soaked & soggy.
The top pieces were ok, kind of a greasy dish over all.
My husband  said it had that duck seasoning kind of taste that he didn't really like.
korean chicken.author: Janel H.
korean chicken.review:
Since I happened to be working next door to this restaurant thought I'd do Chinese takeout for dinner tonight. Yelp reviews were raving so much about the Korean chicken I had to try it. Only ordered the Korean chicken & pot stickers (since everyone seemed to rave about that too). 

Both were jus ok for me. Since the korean chicken is fried & doused w/ all that spicy/sweet sauce, it really needs to be eaten right away (I did take out & was 15 mins away from home) by the time I got home the chicken on the bottom was soaked & soggy. The top pieces were ok, kind of a greasy dish over all. My husband  said it had that duck seasoning kind of taste that he didn't really like. Not a good dish for leftovers either. 

The potstickers didn't come w/ any special sauce so I made my own (vinegar, soy sauce, cilantro & threw in a few chili slices). They were pretty small & expected more for a $5 appetizer. 

For these 2 dishes, paid $12.37.

excerpts: but I guess its all about the Korean Chicken everyone is talking about.
I did  notice the guy in front of me order it.
I may go back just to see what the hype is.
Until then the hype is just Ok and mediocre to me.
Just another average asian restaurant.
Not bad on the pocket though!
korean chicken.author: Chris S.
korean chicken.review: Another Yelp adventure I decided to go with this place.  It got 4 stars on Yelp so it must be good right?  Meh!  The place is a good size for a divey place.  Two dining rooms.  Service is not the best and had to wait for a menu and to order.  Prices are definitely on the low side.  The tea had a hint of of either tea bag or sink water after taste.  I guess i got used to it.  I got chicken won ton soup without noodles.  It was less than $6.  You get a small bowl with more than enough wontons.  I didn't like the bock choy though.  They left the ends on and they looked brownish/yellow which i take as either aged and unfresh.  Ends should be white.  If you want a full meal definitely get the soup with noodles, it might fill you up more.  I decided to order a rice plate to-go which was the curry chicken.  For dinner, I reheated the food and it was good.  White meat with a curry sauce that is very good.  Not salty and not too rich.  A lot of onions as usual but cooked right.  One thing that i didn't like was it lacked veggies.  I was looking for carrots at least but it had green peppers.  Potatoes would have been nice.  I'd have to say it was better than the soup.  I don't know about the 4 stars but I guess its all about the Korean Chicken everyone is talking about.  I did  notice the guy in front of me order it.  I may go back just to see what the hype is.  Until then the hype is just Ok and mediocre to me.  Just another average asian restaurant.  Not bad on the pocket though!

excerpts: Try the Korean Chicken, it is by far some of the best you can find in the Mission District.
korean chicken.author: Mike V.
korean chicken.review:
YES!!! I'M THE FIRST!!

Simply put, this is my favorite Chinese Restaurant in the Mission.

There are always plenty of tables, so you never have to worry about not finding a seat.

The food is delicious.  Try the Korean Chicken, it is by far some of the best you can find in the Mission District.  The food is also reasonably priced, which is always nice for your pocket/wallet/purse.

There are usually parking around the block somewhere, metered, but parking nonetheless.

I really can't find anything wrong with the place.  In fact, I think I may just go there tomorrow.

excerpts: Their chow fun is off da hook and the boneless Korean chicken is TDF.
korean chicken.author: A P.
korean chicken.review:
Just ordered yesterday from my cell in the car, less than ten minutes later I was in the there walking out after paying for the food I ordered....They are super fast, super cheap and super delish!

************************************************************

Never dined in here, but love to pick up for take out!  this place just has it going on!  Having some friends over for dinner and don't want to cook, but you don't want cheesy take out.  The call up the friendly folks at Heung Yuen.  Their chow fun is off da hook and the boneless Korean chicken is TDF.  

So when your guest come over, just make sure everything is in bowls and you have pots on the stove. "why thank you, I'm glad you loved it, I've been slaving over the stove all day!"  **wink***

excerpts: Oh did i mention the korean chicken.
its to die for.
please try it.
korean chicken.author: TINO G.
korean chicken.review:
1 word "awesome"

I've been coming here since I was born and so has my family. This place is great/ Great quality food and in a timely manner too. The wait staff is excellent always there when you need them. im glad the turtle guy left he was a meenie but everyone else is super great. Oh did i mention the korean chicken. its to die for. please try it.

excerpts: I've got out of bed on my days off and driven to The City just for the Korean Chicken.
Even if you're not in the area, like I said the Korean Chicken is worth the drive!!!
korean chicken.author: True C.
korean chicken.review:
Another timeless SF hole in the wall. I've been coming here over ten years now, my parents and grandparents over 25 years. When my family and I come for Sunday dinner, the staff know our menu selections without asking. If you speak to some of the waiters in Spanish, they even understand and are able to respond. Pretty cool if you ask me. 
 
The prices and portions are very excellent. I've got out of bed on my days off and driven to The City just for the Korean Chicken. The chef special Mongolian Beef i just as good. I found it rather interesting that much of the menu provided Spanish translation...only in The MIssion lol. 

Parking is HORRENDOUS. I prefer parking at the Mission and Bartlett garage but that's just personal preference. Eating in is great when time permits (the portions seem to be bigger that waylol) but they're pretty fast with take out. 

If you're looking for fast, cheap, delicious Chinese food - this is the place to go. Even if you're not in the area, like I said the Korean Chicken is worth the drive!!!

excerpts: Crave for their BBQ Pork Rice and Korean Chicken Wing.
Quality was excellent, tasteful, great amount served for price.
Price was good for the food worth it.
Customer Service was good and food was made quick.
Recommend to people who love Chinese Food.
Would come back here again.
korean chicken.author: Gruber T.
korean chicken.review: Order food to go last Saturday. Crave for their BBQ Pork Rice and Korean Chicken Wing. Quality was excellent, tasteful, great amount served for price. Price was good for the food worth it. Customer Service was good and food was made quick. Recommend to people who love Chinese Food. Would come back here again.

excerpts: The Korean chicken is absolutely delicious, and the pot stickers are to die for!!
everything in this restaurant is cooked fresh and with love.
If you been coming here for years they always remember you.
its crazy.
It may not look like much from the outside but this is for sure my favorite place to eat Korean / Chinese food.
Its a definite must try!!
and hey if you don't like it...just don't ever go back.
i will always go back to this place tho.
DELICIOUS.
korean chicken.author: Sarah A.
korean chicken.review: This is the best of the best when it comes to Korean / Chinese food. The Korean chicken is absolutely delicious, and the pot stickers are to die for!! everything in this restaurant is cooked fresh and with love.If you been coming here for years they always remember you. its crazy. It may not look like much from the outside but this is for sure my favorite place to eat Korean / Chinese food. Its a definite must try!! and hey if you don't like it...just don't ever go back. i will always go back to this place tho. DELICIOUS.

excerpts: And it looks like once I do go back, according to the peeps here, I need to try the Korean Chicken :D
korean chicken.author: Chris S.
korean chicken.review:
I have a soft spot for this place. This has been the restaurant my family has been going to for as long as I can remember eating my first portion of steamed rice... which believe me... was a long time ago. I have been spoiled by other Chinese food and can't really eat anywhere else. I'm pretty sure there's better restaurants out there, but I haven't really found one yet.

First, let me talk about the service. They treat you like a part of the family... especially my family and me. The elderly lady is REALLY nice and hospitable, and the waiters are always polite and smiling. I could probably go on about how much I really love the people there, but I'll spare you... other than share that the elderly lady gave me a box of Chinese candy when she found out I was leaving for Amsterdam for studying abroad... but I'm sure she only did that because I've been going there for so long... but anyways.

The food is great. Well, the food that my mom always orders is great. From experience, I can tell you these dishes are outstanding.
- The Sesame Chicken (my absolute favorite)
- Pork Fried Rice
- Beef Chow Mein and Chow Fun
- Orange Chicken
- Korean Beef (from what I remember when I use to eat beef)
- Pot Stickers
- Walnut Prawns

There's a lot of other dishes that are great that aren't coming to mind at this moment. It's been a while since I've been there, but when I do finally come back home and I'm in the mood for Chinese, this place is mandatory. And it looks like once I do go back, according to the peeps here, I need to try the Korean Chicken :D

excerpts:
Recommendations: 
Korean Chicken 
Fried Whole Fish w/ Black Bean Sauce
Beef Won-Ton Soup
korean chicken.author: Lisa T.
korean chicken.review:
If you are the type of person that thinks Panda Express is authentic Chinese food, you need a reality check and check out who's cooking up your combo plate. But anyways, Heung Yuen is one the closest to authentic that you'll get outside of Chinatown. I agree with the reviews below....it is pretty greasy and the place does look a bit grungy, but like my boyfriend says "the dirty lookin' places always make really good food." (but please don't make that a rule of thumb). Back to the review: Heung Yuen does serve up some good food and their menu has almost 200 different dishes, so you have plenty to choose from. We also found out today that you can order off-menu Chinese food too! Yum!  I also recommend ordering take-out because the service is not that great when you are eating in, but they'll cook anything in 20 mins or less for you to pick up! Good place to give a try!

Recommendations: 
Korean Chicken 
Fried Whole Fish w/ Black Bean Sauce
Beef Won-Ton Soup

excerpts: I looooove the boneless Korean chicken, and their greasy chow mein does the trick too!
korean chicken.author: Valerie A.
korean chicken.review:
Total hole in the wall that my family has been ordering take out from since as long as I can remember.  I looooove the boneless Korean chicken, and their greasy chow mein does the trick too! :)

I've eaten in the restaurant no more than 10 times in my lifetime- and I recommend takeout, which I've had 100 times, unless you want to see them making the potstickers/wontons on the table in front of you...I'd rather not! :)

excerpts: The older Asian woman always remembers me and what I order, which is the Korean Chicken which is my favorite dish.
The potstickers are the freshest and tastiest.
The pork fried rice is savory and the chow mein is great!
It's one of the many fantastic places in the city.
korean chicken.author: Fonzo A.
korean chicken.review: This is one of the best Chinese food places in SF. The food is cooked fresh!! Very Delicious. I was born and raised in the Mission District. Me and my family have been going here for over 20 years! I grew up on this food . I will always love this place. The older Asian woman always remembers me and what I order, which is the Korean Chicken which is my favorite dish. The potstickers are the freshest and tastiest. The pork fried rice is savory and the chow mein is great!  It's one of the many fantastic places in the city.

excerpts: Only for their Korean Chicken and Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce.
korean chicken.author: Chloe C.
korean chicken.review:
Five stars! Only for their Korean Chicken and Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce. Scrumpdididleyuptious.

And yes, it is a hole in the wall, but a delicious one at that.

excerpts: The fam loves them the Korean Chicken, but I've had better (not that it tastes bad).
korean chicken.author: M R.
korean chicken.review:
Strictly for the Broccoli Beef! The fam loves them the Korean Chicken, but I've had better (not that it tastes bad).

And yeah it's true it's not a great looking location, but it's obvious people come for the food!!!

Never been in the bathroom, not sure if I want, too..but because they are a busy spot it comforts me that the food is fresh!

excerpts: The Korean Chicken is probably the best thing on their menu, but everything else doesn't fall too short behind it.
It doesn't get a five-star review because the food here can be a bit overpriced, but it doesn't stop me from coming here at least 2 a month.
Everyone here is very friendly and never fail to smile at me.
Always recommend this place to a friend.
korean chicken.author: Sheryl F.
korean chicken.review: Food here is amazing. The Korean Chicken is probably the best thing on their menu, but everything else doesn't fall too short behind it. It doesn't get a five-star review because the food here can be a bit overpriced, but it doesn't stop me from coming here at least 2 a month. Everyone here is very friendly and never fail to smile at me. Always recommend this place to a friend.

excerpts: Based on the recommendation of a friend, I tried the Korean Chicken and it was awesome.
We only order one other dish, the Mixed Vegetable Chow Mein
and it was pretty bland.
korean chicken.author: John F.
korean chicken.review: Based on the recommendation of a friend, I tried the Korean Chicken and it was awesome. We only order one other dish, the Mixed Vegetable Chow Mein and it was pretty bland.

excerpts: Korean Chicken.
Let the sugary sauce drizzle over your fried rice, or chow mein
and you'll be all smiles when you're done.
korean chicken.author: Bonene G.
korean chicken.review: Korean Chicken. Let the sugary sauce drizzle over your fried rice, or chow mein and you'll be all smiles when you're done.

excerpts: Korean Chicken.
I was introduced to this masterpiece by a good friend of mine.
I had no reason to doubt his taste, but I did when I found myself going to this dumpy little restaurant across the street from Boogaloos.
I questioned it "Are you sure about this?
Last thing I need is gnarly mudbutt.
I love this place, for no other reason than the Korean Chicken.
korean chicken.author: Arnold S.
korean chicken.review:
I am writing this review for one reason, and one reason alone. Korean Chicken. I was introduced to this masterpiece by a good friend of mine. I had no reason to doubt his taste, but I did when I found myself going to this dumpy little restaurant across the street from Boogaloos. I questioned it "Are you sure about this? Last thing I need is gnarly mudbutt."

This chicken is amazing, for about 8 bucks you can get more rice and chicken than you can eat. The spicy version of it has the right amount of spice and sweetness. I love this place, for no other reason than the Korean Chicken.

excerpts: the Korean Chicken is great., but you should also try the Korean Shrimp.
It is made exactly like the chicken and it too is great!
Usually I call in my order and it's ready in 10 minutes.
You can't beat that.
korean chicken.author: Bert Z.
korean chicken.review: Everyone is right....the Korean Chicken is great., but you should also try the Korean Shrimp.  It is made exactly like the chicken and it too is great! Usually I call in my order and it's ready in 10 minutes.  You can't beat that.

excerpts: The one and only thing I had here was the Korean Chicken,
OMG so fricking good.
Crunchy, sweet but not in a traditional sweet and sour way.
Dang its been forever
but I must make it back soon.
korean chicken.author: La C.
korean chicken.review: I was introduced to this place back in my college days by my friend that grew up in the Mission.  The one and only thing I had here was the Korean Chicken, OMG so fricking good.  Crunchy, sweet but not in a traditional sweet and sour way.  Dang its been forever but I must make it back soon.

excerpts: Other favorites are Korean Chicken and pot stickers.
korean chicken.author: K H.
korean chicken.review:
I work in an office down the street, and 90% of the time we go out for lunch with the entire crew, we come here.  Maybe 95%.

It's not the best food in the city or anything, but there's a HUGE menu, it's cheap, it's quick, and the service is very friendly (helps if you go almost every day).  

Their lunch special is some of the best deals round.  Fried rice will feed a family of 18 for under $5.  Their noodle wonton soup is great on a cold day.  Their salt-baked dishes are FANTASTIC.  It's not on the menu, but try a side of Chinese broccoli with garlic sauce.  Other favorites are Korean Chicken and pot stickers.

UPDATE: Spare Ribs in Black Bean sauce over rice.  Trust me.

excerpts: 4 stars for their Korean Chicken only.
I don't get it spicy because my other half can't hang with spicy.
Beats me why a Chinese restaurant makes such a yummy "Korean" chicken, but it is damn good.
korean chicken.author: christine t.
korean chicken.review: 4 stars for their Korean Chicken only. I don't get it spicy because my other half can't hang with spicy. Beats me why a Chinese restaurant makes such a yummy "Korean" chicken, but it is damn good.

excerpts:
7/23/2009, take out

korean chicken -- sugar, coloring agent overloaded sauce.
korean chicken.author: Yi S.
korean chicken.review:
7/23/2009, take out

korean chicken -- sugar, coloring agent overloaded sauce. get better version in Sunset area.

house chowmein  -- tasteless, noodles is rough.

your average chinese takeout junk fast food joint.

excerpts: But if you like good chinese food for good prices and the best Korean chicken then give it a try!
Oh and try the take-out...
It literally took me 8 minutes to order, go and pick up!...
korean chicken.author: Laura C.
korean chicken.review: I was introduced to chinese food at this restaurant at the age of 12.  Have loved it ever since.  The beef won ton soup is great! So is the chef's special chow mein and the Korean beef.  The portions are generous, the prices are perfect, the staff helpful.  If you want something elegant, spacious and refined this restaurant is NOT for you! But if you like good chinese food for good prices and the best Korean chicken then give it a try! Oh and try the take-out... It literally took me 8 minutes to order, go and pick up!...

excerpts: It seems people have found my "my little hole in the wall can't go wrong with the korean chicken".
Really, that's what I call it.
Anyways, the actual review is short...
all five stars for the korean chicken.
Go for the spanish speaking chinese waiters; stay for the korean chicken.
korean chicken.author: Brent A.
korean chicken.review: As my profile states, I always say that I'm going to start yelping one day. Well boys and girls....today is that day. And what better place to start with than the one I have been frequenting for as long as I can remember. And here I thought I'd be the first to review this place not the 18th. It seems people have found my "my little hole in the wall can't go wrong with the korean chicken". Really, that's what I call it. Anyways, the actual review is short... all five stars for the korean chicken. Go for the spanish speaking chinese waiters; stay for the korean chicken.

excerpts: like they they negotiated with me when I said the $17 they wanted to charge me for Korean chicken, steamed vegetables, and
rice was way too much.
korean chicken.author: James R.
korean chicken.review: a bit bland, but nice people, and I like they they negotiated with me when I said the $17 they wanted to charge me for Korean chicken, steamed vegetables, and rice was way too much.

excerpts: Boneless Korean chicken, house chow mein, shrimp fried rice, honey walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, & wonton soup.
boneless korean chicken.author: Jacqueline R.
boneless korean chicken.review:
My favorite Chinese restaurant in the City. I'm a native of SF's Mission district, where we lived down the street & this was the spot for family celebrations. I remember as a kid, turning the lazy Susan table top as we anxiously waited for our meal. Now as an adult, this is still by far--the go-to for amazing Chino food. 

Personal favs: Boneless Korean chicken, house chow mein, shrimp fried rice, honey walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, & wonton soup. Yummy! 

Great food & the staff are so warm & friendly. Ricky (staff) is the dude! You won't be disappointed. Try it out. :)

excerpts: I prefer the BONELESS Korean chicken - white meat nuggets breaded and glazed.
The chowmein is fresh - no noodles stuck together or stale texture and  the staff is always friendly.
Ricky ( the smartass waiter sometimes with the pompadour) is especially friendly as had a great sense of humor.
Since we always order the same stuff he just asks if we're gonna have the same today.
lol

The potstickers are good - I really don't eat them from anywhere else (I'm an egg roll guy) but with the vinegar and oil chili mixture which Ricky usually mixes at the table for us makes them very tasty.
I'm glad the hipsters go everywhere else because I like this place despite the area
boneless korean chicken.author: Main M.
boneless korean chicken.review: We really enjoy this place. It really is your typical Chinese food place though. I prefer the BONELESS Korean chicken - white meat nuggets breaded and glazed. The chowmein is fresh - no noodles stuck together or stale texture and  the staff is always friendly. Ricky ( the smartass waiter sometimes with the pompadour) is especially friendly as had a great sense of humor. Since we always order the same stuff he just asks if we're gonna have the same today. lol The potstickers are good - I really don't eat them from anywhere else (I'm an egg roll guy) but with the vinegar and oil chili mixture which Ricky usually mixes at the table for us makes them very tasty. I'm glad the hipsters go everywhere else because I like this place despite the area

excerpts: Here AGAIN having my usual - boneless Korean chicken, shrimp chow fun, steamed rice.
The service is ALWAYS FAST & FRIENDLY!
boneless korean chicken.author: Shana F.
boneless korean chicken.review: Here AGAIN having my usual - boneless Korean chicken, shrimp chow fun, steamed rice. The service is ALWAYS FAST & FRIENDLY!

excerpts: Their chow fun is off da hook and the boneless Korean chicken is TDF.
boneless korean chicken.author: A P.
boneless korean chicken.review:
Just ordered yesterday from my cell in the car, less than ten minutes later I was in the there walking out after paying for the food I ordered....They are super fast, super cheap and super delish!

************************************************************

Never dined in here, but love to pick up for take out!  this place just has it going on!  Having some friends over for dinner and don't want to cook, but you don't want cheesy take out.  The call up the friendly folks at Heung Yuen.  Their chow fun is off da hook and the boneless Korean chicken is TDF.  

So when your guest come over, just make sure everything is in bowls and you have pots on the stove. "why thank you, I'm glad you loved it, I've been slaving over the stove all day!"  **wink***

excerpts: I looooove the boneless Korean chicken, and their greasy chow mein does the trick too!
boneless korean chicken.author: Valerie A.
boneless korean chicken.review:
Total hole in the wall that my family has been ordering take out from since as long as I can remember.  I looooove the boneless Korean chicken, and their greasy chow mein does the trick too! :)

I've eaten in the restaurant no more than 10 times in my lifetime- and I recommend takeout, which I've had 100 times, unless you want to see them making the potstickers/wontons on the table in front of you...I'd rather not! :)

excerpts: A group of us ordered family style; salted dried fish/diced chicken fried rice, Chinese broccoli stir fried, chow fun, chow mein, stir fry seafood with mixed greens and their absolutely delicious fried chicken.
The pieces of chicken was just the right temperature hot with a sweet saucy glaze .
If it wasn't for the chicken, I don't know if I would come here again.
The rest of the food was nothing to write home about, because it wasn't tasty.
fried chicken.author: Mabe S.
fried chicken.review: In the Mission district SF is this hole in the wall Chinese restaurant . A group of us ordered family style; salted dried fish/diced chicken fried rice, Chinese broccoli stir fried, chow fun, chow mein, stir fry seafood with mixed greens and their absolutely delicious fried chicken.  The pieces of chicken was just the right temperature hot with a sweet saucy glaze .  If it wasn't for the chicken, I don't know if I would come here again.  The rest of the food was nothing to write home about, because it wasn't tasty.

excerpts: Went here based on a recommendation from a colleague and simply got the Korean fried chicken and was not disappointed.
Sweet delicious tasting chicken wings ,would return to get some to go for sure.
fried chicken.author: Rod M.
fried chicken.review: Went here based on a recommendation from a colleague and simply got the Korean fried chicken and was not disappointed. Sweet delicious tasting chicken wings ,would return to get some to go for sure.

excerpts: I absolutely love the Korean Fried Chicken wings!
I get lost in the sauce!
fried chicken.author: Xavier G.
fried chicken.review: Dank city! Love this spot! Wish they were open longer but I still frequent when I can. I absolutely love the Korean Fried Chicken wings! I get lost in the sauce!

excerpts: The fried chicken wings in the spicy sauce and the beef and rice noodle dish is good.
fried chicken.author: Anthony L.
fried chicken.review: Good Chinese food but the fried rice is not so good. The combo fried rice has no eggs in it and the shrimp are very small. The fried chicken wings in the spicy sauce and the beef and rice noodle dish is good. The shrimp wonton soup rules.

excerpts: I made 3 orders of the Korean Fried Chicken, and made some rice and salad at home.
fried chicken.author: Vi T.
fried chicken.review:
I'm incredibly grateful for this find.

If San Tung is 10/10 quality, this place is 9/10 and much cheaper and closer to me. There was no wait and service was incredibly quick.

I made 3 orders of the Korean Fried Chicken, and made some rice and salad at home. This was enough to make 6 people incredibly full, so the portions here are great.

Definitely coming back to this place, and will most likely order to-go again because the place itself is a bit too dark for me to feel happy eating one hell of a great meal. LOL. but seriously, it's delicious.

excerpts: out- korean fried chicken and the special fried rice.
portion size is great.
fried chicken.author: Sarina A.
fried chicken.review: the korean chicken is soo good!!! why go all the way to san tung when this is in the mission?! plus, the chicken wings here are way bigger than san tung. we always order take out- korean fried chicken and the special fried rice. portion size is great.

excerpts: The Korean fried chicken has me coming back here again and again.
Compared to San Tung's wings, these are larger and err more on the sweeter side.
Compared to SO's chicken wings, Heung Yuen's definitely tone down the spice
fried chicken.author: Kathleen W.
fried chicken.review:
Simple and sweet food of my people.

As a descendant of a family that owned and ran its own Chinese American restaurant, places like Heung Yuen hold a special place in my heart.  This restaurant has potential with its large tables to accommodate big groups and Chinese families, but every time I go here, the restaurant is below its capacity. The food and decor is simply not trendy enough for the Valencia St crowd and that's okay.  We gotta have some budget food options in this expensive city!

The Korean fried chicken has me coming back here again and again.  Compared to San Tung's wings, these are larger and err more on the sweeter side.  Compared to SO's chicken wings, Heung Yuen's definitely tone down the spice (I prefer the sweet).  

Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...whatever I'm feeling that day.  They are all accompaniments for the main attraction (those wings tho)!! 

Service is speedy.  Menus are tri-lingual (English, Spanish, and Chinese).  And like I said, their prices won't break the bank.

excerpts: Having not to settle for fast food, or fried chicken, I looked up Chinese food and Heung Yuen was only a block away from the USBank building.
Upon arrival, I still had to wait an additional 20 minutes for my food, after calling in for pick-up, and purposely walking-slow along 22nd
St. Are you kidding me?!
fried chicken.author: Tiffany M.
fried chicken.review:
I was near by at the WIX Lounge doing some work, and needed lunch. Having not to settle for fast food, or fried chicken, I looked up Chinese food and Heung Yuen was only a block away from the USBank building. Upon arrival, I still had to wait an additional 20 minutes for my food, after calling in for pick-up, and purposely walking-slow along 22nd St. Are you kidding me?! Although, it was affordable, I didn't like the style of service of an open kitchen door open for guest at the dining area to see. 

(A personal preference of mine - I don't like seeing my food prepared. Especially at hole-in-the wall places like these.) 

I sat down, and waited for my food. Checked in on Foursquare, checked my Twitter, and Facebook - and still no food. I seriously bet, they didn't start making my order until I arrived. -___- 

Although the uncomfortable wait, the food was delicious, like any other Chinese place. I was super hungry -  and everything I ordered was perfect. Nothing new. But satisfying enough..

excerpts: I like to think that as a young child, my love for fried chicken started here.
No lie.
With my parents' house less than a block away, my mom would take me and my brother here after elementary school and what do I remember vividly?
A plate of their Korean fried chicken.
fried chicken.author: Geralyn Y.
fried chicken.review:
I like to think that as a young child, my love for fried chicken started here. No lie. With my parents' house less than a block away, my mom would take me and my brother here after elementary school and what do I remember vividly? A plate of their Korean fried chicken.

For whatever reason we stopped our visits (though not because the food was bad). 
Whenever I would walk by I would wonder if everything was as good as I remembered. It must have been, because it has been open for at least the past 20 years. 

Well I finally got around to seeing if it still lived up to my childhood hype. Need my five stars say any more? The wings are just as good if not better than I remember. We also ordered chow mein, egg rolls, and beef and broccoli. The bill came out to less than $30. Good prices. Even better food. I'm coming back, and this time I won't wait as long to return.

excerpts: The minced beef soup and the korean fried chicken wings, while not like Bonchon's, are both pretty good.
fried chicken.author: Aaron W.
fried chicken.review: There's not many hole in the wall Chinese places in the mission, so it's nice to have this place nearby.  They have a pretty big menu of all the real standby items I crave with very reasonable prices.  This is a place I would take my chinese dad and he'd enjoy it more than going to somewhere like R&G because the low prices make the food taste all the better.  The minced beef soup and the korean fried chicken wings, while not like Bonchon's, are both pretty good.

excerpts: Per the rave reviews, we ordered the Korean fried chicken boneless and got a side of white rice and their Chef Special chow mein.
Yes the chicken was yummy!
I felt like it had more breading than meat, but that's what makes it so good, right?
The chicken was fried just right, making it crispy and juicy.
And that sauce.
Omg that sauce is killer!
I'm wondering if they'll share that recipe with me
so I can whip it up at home and slather all types of meat into it.
I think it's just honey and some sort of spicy sauce and crushed red peppers.
The chow mein was fine.
fried chicken.author: Joy L.
fried chicken.review:
Pretty decent Chinese food. Per the rave reviews, we ordered the Korean fried chicken boneless and got a side of white rice and their Chef Special chow mein. Yes the chicken was yummy! I felt like it had more breading than meat, but that's what makes it so good, right? The chicken was fried just right, making it crispy and juicy. And that sauce. Omg that sauce is killer! I'm wondering if they'll share that recipe with me so I can whip it up at home and slather all types of meat into it. I think it's just honey and some sort of spicy sauce and crushed red peppers. The chow mein was fine. It was pretty oily and they were stingey when it came to meat and vegetables, but we still enjoyed it.  

The staff is friendly and attentive. It's certainly not a place where you'd wanna take a first date to (it was obviously a Mexican restaurant in its past life), so you can call in your order for pick up if you prefer that. Also, they're closed on Sundays.

excerpts: The food is uneven, ranging from decent to unacceptable (e.g., noodles that are partially raw, deep fried chicken that is sufficiently undercooked to have dough oozing out of it when you bite into it, etc.).
fried chicken.author: Jared B.
fried chicken.review:
An ok place. Unfortunately, better than most the Chinese alternatives in this area, so I find myself going back there occasionally in spite of myself. Someone really needs to start a consistently good Chinese take-out restaurant around 21st-24th and Mission and put all these mediocre places out of business.

The food is uneven, ranging from decent to unacceptable (e.g., noodles that are partially raw, deep fried chicken that is sufficiently undercooked to have dough oozing out of it when you bite into it, etc.).

The service is likewise inconsistent. One guy is incredibly smilely and nice, while another guy acts like you're an idiot when you can't read his mind (to know, e.g., that they're out of an ingredient or closing 15 minutes before their stated closing time).

I find the potstickers to be ok--worth getting if you're there, but not worth going out of the way to get them. They're just kinda normal potstickers that you'd get in a restaurant--certainly above frozen quality, but nothing to dream about.

excerpts: The sesame chicken is my personal favorite, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.
Great food.
Huge Menu.
Fast service.
Clean.
Friendly staff.
Great prices.
Can't beat it!
Definitely the best neighborhood Chinese joint.
I highly recommend it!
sesame chicken.author: Melanie K.
sesame chicken.review: YUM! This hole in the wall Chinese restaurant has quickly become the regular go to spot for my roommate and I. The combos are the way to go, so much yummy food for under $8! The sesame chicken is my personal favorite, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Great food. Huge Menu. Fast service. Clean. Friendly staff. Great prices. Can't beat it! Definitely the best neighborhood Chinese joint. I highly recommend it!

excerpts: I usually stick to the sesame chicken because it is fantastic.
It's a great neighborhood find, I highly recommend it!
sesame chicken.author: Mandy A.
sesame chicken.review: My roommate and I were on the hunt for a good Chinese place near our apartment. We did take out a number of times from places that were really disappointing. Then we found this place and decided to just go in and that my friends, was an excellent decision. It's quick, it's fresh, it's delicious and it's cheap! The kitchen is open to the restaurant, which I really like, so you can watch the chefs. They have a good combo deal that gets you a full plate of food (meat dish, rice, egg roll or pot stickets) for under $8. Service is friendly and fast. Menu is extensive. I usually stick to the sesame chicken because it is fantastic. It's a great neighborhood find, I highly recommend it!

excerpts: We ordered the garlic green beans, sesame chicken, beef broccoli, chicken won ton soup, and bbq pork fried rice.
The won ton soup, sesame chicken, and garlic green beans were amazing.
Would definitely recommend.
The service was very fast and super friendly.
The ambience inside could use a little TLC but that would be my only suggestion and we did take out so i could care less.
sesame chicken.author: Emma V.
sesame chicken.review: Ordered take out from here for the first time tonight. We ordered the garlic green beans, sesame chicken, beef broccoli, chicken won ton soup, and bbq pork fried rice. The won ton soup, sesame chicken, and garlic green beans were amazing. Would definitely recommend. The service was very fast and super friendly. The ambience inside could use a little TLC but that would be my only suggestion and we did take out so i could care less. :)

excerpts:
- The Sesame Chicken (my absolute favorite)
- Pork Fried Rice
- Beef Chow Mein and Chow Fun
- Orange Chicken
- Korean Beef (from what I remember when I use to eat beef)
- Pot Stickers
- Walnut Prawns
sesame chicken.author: Chris S.
sesame chicken.review:
I have a soft spot for this place. This has been the restaurant my family has been going to for as long as I can remember eating my first portion of steamed rice... which believe me... was a long time ago. I have been spoiled by other Chinese food and can't really eat anywhere else. I'm pretty sure there's better restaurants out there, but I haven't really found one yet.

First, let me talk about the service. They treat you like a part of the family... especially my family and me. The elderly lady is REALLY nice and hospitable, and the waiters are always polite and smiling. I could probably go on about how much I really love the people there, but I'll spare you... other than share that the elderly lady gave me a box of Chinese candy when she found out I was leaving for Amsterdam for studying abroad... but I'm sure she only did that because I've been going there for so long... but anyways.

The food is great. Well, the food that my mom always orders is great. From experience, I can tell you these dishes are outstanding.
- The Sesame Chicken (my absolute favorite)
- Pork Fried Rice
- Beef Chow Mein and Chow Fun
- Orange Chicken
- Korean Beef (from what I remember when I use to eat beef)
- Pot Stickers
- Walnut Prawns

There's a lot of other dishes that are great that aren't coming to mind at this moment. It's been a while since I've been there, but when I do finally come back home and I'm in the mood for Chinese, this place is mandatory. And it looks like once I do go back, according to the peeps here, I need to try the Korean Chicken :D

excerpts: i had something really basic, likely sesame chicken, as that's my go-to at any unfamiliar chinese restaurant.
sesame chicken.author: Brady W.
sesame chicken.review:
i'd assume, by the fact that the place is always empty, that anyone on foot would know better than to stop to eat here. i'm writing this review more for the folks who get a menu tacked to their door and think, "why not try it for delivery, sight-unseen?"  

the "why not" answer is easy... the food (in my experience) was gross.  while i'm intrigued by one reviewer's comments on the pot stickers, i just can't fathom eating here again.  i had something really basic, likely sesame chicken, as that's my go-to at any unfamiliar chinese restaurant.  the chicken was... how to say... stringy, chewy, lathered in too much sauce.

while there are not many good options for chinese in the mission, i'd advise you to skip this one (try Yum Yum House or get delivery from Jasmine Tea House, they're both quite good).

excerpts: Got a combo with orange chicken and pork Chow mein.
Nothing really to write home about but the food was tasty with big portions.
4 stars for the good value!
orange chicken.author: Joon Kee P.
orange chicken.review:
Got take-out and had a decent experience. Got a combo with orange chicken and pork Chow mein. Nothing really to write home about but the food was tasty with big portions. 
4 stars for the good value!

excerpts: Lemon and orange chicken.
orange chicken.author: Steven A.
orange chicken.review: OMG. OMG. OMG. THIS IS THE BEST PLACE. We had the pork friend rice. Lemon and orange chicken. KOREAN CHICKEN is better than sex. Chow fun combination with black bean sauce. Chow mein pepper beef with black bean sauce. I bring all my guests here and they leave astonished. Had friends here from Finland. France. And all over the USA. It os amazing!!!

excerpts: The orange chicken was crispy yet tender in the middle and the Mongolian beef pieces had great flavor and nice traces of heat (note it's not spicy).
The pieces of meat felt hearty not like the typical super pounded almost fake tasting typical meat served at other places
orange chicken.author: Genica R.
orange chicken.review: Definitely the best standard no frills Chinese food I've ever eaten. The orange chicken was crispy yet tender in the middle and the Mongolian beef pieces had great flavor and nice traces of heat (note it's not spicy). The pieces of meat felt hearty not like the typical super pounded almost fake tasting typical meat served at other places

excerpts: I ordered orange chicken over rice, chicken chow mein and the korean chicken wings.
The wings are sooo tasty they are pretty good compared to the other food I ordered.
Like in other reviews mention I agree they are a bit too sweet but still pretty good.
The only thing is that they are really greasy.
The orange chicken over rice I got had a hair in the rice which completly grossed me out
so I ended up throwing that in the trash.
The chicken chow mein has no kind of flavor at all i swear panda express's chow mein is so much better then this one.
The only reason why its getting 2 stars is cause the korean wings are good.
orange chicken.author: Gabriela R.
orange chicken.review:
So  I went to this place because it had 4 stars and the food looked really yummy. I ordered orange chicken over rice, chicken chow mein and the korean chicken wings. 
The wings are sooo tasty they are pretty good compared to the other food I ordered. Like in other reviews mention I agree they are a bit too sweet but still pretty good. The only thing is that they are really greasy. The orange chicken over rice I got had a hair in the rice which completly grossed me out so I ended up throwing that in the trash. The chicken chow mein has no kind of flavor at all i swear panda express's chow mein is so much better then this one. The only reason why its getting 2 stars is cause the korean wings are good.

excerpts: They all had some weird oil taste to it and the orange chicken we ordered was so hard from the inside that we lost our appetites.
orange chicken.author: Ashaba C.
orange chicken.review:
I really have no idea why this restaurant is rated so highly. First of all, the pitcher of water that was given to us was extremely filthy. We had to ask for bottled water. Their service is poor, no one asked us if we enjoyed our food or needed anything else. We ordered plenty of dishes and none of them edible. They all had some weird oil taste to it and the orange chicken we ordered was so hard from the inside that we lost our appetites. 

The worst part is how they added service fee on their own when we were even really provided with much of it.

excerpts: Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...
whatever I'm feeling that day.
kung pao tofu.author: Kathleen W.
kung pao tofu.review:
Simple and sweet food of my people.

As a descendant of a family that owned and ran its own Chinese American restaurant, places like Heung Yuen hold a special place in my heart.  This restaurant has potential with its large tables to accommodate big groups and Chinese families, but every time I go here, the restaurant is below its capacity. The food and decor is simply not trendy enough for the Valencia St crowd and that's okay.  We gotta have some budget food options in this expensive city!

The Korean fried chicken has me coming back here again and again.  Compared to San Tung's wings, these are larger and err more on the sweeter side.  Compared to SO's chicken wings, Heung Yuen's definitely tone down the spice (I prefer the sweet).  

Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...whatever I'm feeling that day.  They are all accompaniments for the main attraction (those wings tho)!! 

Service is speedy.  Menus are tri-lingual (English, Spanish, and Chinese).  And like I said, their prices won't break the bank.

excerpts: Only for their Korean Chicken and Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce.
broccoli with oyster sauce.author: Chloe C.
broccoli with oyster sauce.review:
Five stars! Only for their Korean Chicken and Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce. Scrumpdididleyuptious.

And yes, it is a hole in the wall, but a delicious one at that.

excerpts: Whenever I try out a new Chinese restaurant I always try their Wonton soup and their Egg Foo Young (if it's on the menu) as those 2 dishes seem the easiest to F'up
and I've had the worst experiences with in the past.
They DO serve EFY
but it's veggie, and I made the mistake of adding chicken.
Clearly, their chicken is pre-cooked and they just add it to dishes when ordered, so this resulted in tough, dry pieces of meat in my dish (-1*).
It would have been amazing w/o the chicken.
My first bite also included a piece of egg shell, as did my second and 20th or so bites.
Next, the wonton soup.
They have Wor Wonton which has everything in it, so I went for that.
The flavor was great, the soup had more ingredients than ANY other WW soup I've ever ordered, but the wonton wrappers were SUPER pasty and soggy (-1*).
So overall, I would eat here again.
Their prices and portion size are commendable in this ridiculous market, and the flavor was good overall.
If not for some consistency and careless additions, it would have garnered a higher rating.
egg foo young.author: D C.
egg foo young.review:
This is a challenging review for me as some things were stellar, and others substandard. 
This was my first time to the restaurant and I got takeout. The service was friendly and timely, so no complaints about that.
Whenever I try out a new Chinese restaurant I always try their Wonton soup and their Egg Foo Young (if it's on the menu) as those 2 dishes seem the easiest to F'up and I've had the worst experiences with in the past.
They DO serve EFY but it's veggie, and I made the mistake of adding chicken. Clearly, their chicken is pre-cooked and they just add it to dishes when ordered, so this resulted in tough, dry pieces of meat in my dish (-1*). It would have been amazing w/o the chicken.
My first bite also included a piece of egg shell, as did my second and 20th or so bites. (-1*)
Next, the wonton soup. 
They have Wor Wonton which has everything in it, so I went for that. The flavor was great, the soup had more ingredients than ANY other WW soup I've ever ordered, but the wonton wrappers were SUPER pasty and soggy (-1*).
So overall, I would eat here again. 
Their prices and portion size are commendable in this ridiculous market, and the flavor was good overall. If not for some consistency and careless additions, it would have garnered a higher rating.

excerpts: So is the chef's special chow mein and the Korean beef.
The portions are generous, the prices are perfect, the staff helpful.
If you want something elegant, spacious and refined this restaurant is NOT for you!
korean beef.author: Laura C.
korean beef.review: I was introduced to chinese food at this restaurant at the age of 12.  Have loved it ever since.  The beef won ton soup is great! So is the chef's special chow mein and the Korean beef.  The portions are generous, the prices are perfect, the staff helpful.  If you want something elegant, spacious and refined this restaurant is NOT for you! But if you like good chinese food for good prices and the best Korean chicken then give it a try! Oh and try the take-out... It literally took me 8 minutes to order, go and pick up!...

excerpts: Honestly blaming myself for not checking the health score before eating here and not listening to myself when I knew the Mongolian beef tasted off.
I'm good at smelling/tasting food
that's gone bad
but I ignored my instincts when my friend who I was sharing the dish with had no complaints.
I'll be having to call out of work tomorrow thanks to this place selling rotten meat.
mongolian beef.author: Sarah L.
mongolian beef.review: I ate here for dinner at 8PM and got food poisoning around 2AM. I'm writing this post in between bathroom runs. Honestly blaming myself for not checking the health score before eating here and not listening to myself when I knew the Mongolian beef tasted off. I'm good at smelling/tasting food that's gone bad but I ignored my instincts when my friend who I was sharing the dish with had no complaints. I'll be having to call out of work tomorrow thanks to this place selling rotten meat.
